lexa.core.expression

Class Numeric

  • java.lang.Object
    • lexa.core.expression.Expression
      • lexa.core.expression.MultipleExpression
        • lexa.core.expression.Numeric
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Add, Divide, Modulus, Multiply, Power, Subtract, Sum

    public abstract class Numeric
extends MultipleExpression
    Base class for numeric expressions.
    This class must be implemented by all classes that will support numeric expression.
    Since:
    2013-03
    Author:
    William

    • Constructor Summary

      protected Numeric(java.lang.Class<?> classType, Expression... expressions)
      Create a multiple expression consisting of a list of expressions.
      protected Numeric(Expression... expressions)
      Create a numeric expression consisting of a list of expressions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Numeric

        protected Numeric(Expression... expressions)
        Create a numeric expression consisting of a list of expressions.
        Parameters:
        expressions - a list of expressions to parse

      • Numeric

        protected Numeric(java.lang.Class<?> classType,
                  Expression... expressions)
        Create a multiple expression consisting of a list of expressions.
        If the class types of the expression is the same as the classType and it's an implementation of Numeric then the the contained expressions are added rather than the container.
        Parameters:
        classType - a class type to allow for concatenation of expressions.
        expressions - a list of expressions to parse

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        protected boolean validate(java.lang.Object result)
                    throws ExpressionException
        Checks if the result of an evaluation is valid.
        Check the result is numeric.
        Overrides:
        validate in class MultipleExpression
        Parameters:
        result - the result from an evaluated expression.
        Returns:
        true if the result is valid.
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - when an error occurs in validating the result.

      • combine

        protected java.lang.Object combine(java.lang.Object overall,
                                   java.lang.Object result)
                            throws ExpressionException
        Combines the existing overall result with the new result.

        Uses the methods calcInteger and calcDouble to evaluate the results.

        Specified by:
        combine in class MultipleExpression
        Parameters:
        overall - the existing result from the previously evaluated expressions.
        result - the result from an evaluated expression.
        Returns:
        The combined result.
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - when an error occurs in combining the result.

      • calcDouble

        protected abstract java.lang.Double calcDouble(java.lang.Double lhs,
                                               java.lang.Double rhs)
        Calculate the result of two Double numbers.

        NB This method must be synonymous with calcInteger

        Parameters:
        lhs - the left hand side of the expression.
        rhs - the right hand side of the expression.
        Returns:
        the result of the calculation.

      • calcInteger

        protected abstract java.lang.Integer calcInteger(java.lang.Integer lhs,
                                                 java.lang.Integer rhs)
        Calculate the result of two Integer numbers.

        NB This method must be synonymous with calcDouble

        Parameters:
        lhs - the left hand side of the expression.
        rhs - the right hand side of the expression.
        Returns:
        the result of the calculation.
